"IWAV0190E: No Bean instantiated for some reason"

Do two things please and tell me what happens:

1) Try changing static class to public static class 
2) Clear the cache:

a) Open a VE, close it and all other VE's.
b) Project->Clean...->Clean all... and wait for build to complete
c) Open the VE.

I don't see any change.  My test class already had the "public" inner class accessbility.  I brought up my Eclipse with VE (so this was a new session) and saw the IWAV0190 error.  I closed the VE (it was the only editor) and did a clean all projects.  Then I brought the VE back up.  Still same error.  

I do not have the final Callisto release, so if you can't reproduce this I'll see if I can update on Monday.

BTW, I have not seen any instances of the Write BeanInfo cache error during this session, so maybe that was unrelated.

Ok, I just tried it with VE 1.2 released. Here are the results.

1)We can't handle "static class", it must be "public static class". 
2) "No bean instantiated" msg is because you are returning null. A null looks to us like there was a problem creating the bean, you need to return something.
3) We are creating a separate java vm to instantiate code. We didn't realize that the inner class had changed if you make any changes to it, such as return a different string. So we didn't recycle the vm and create a new one. So after changes to the inner class you need to close the VE and reopen it again so that you pick up the changed inner class.

These aren't the most desirable ways it should work, but this is at least your workaround for now.
Okay, thanks for checking this out.
I'm going to close this for now as worksforme since it is a current restriction. I've just opened several defects to address these problems for future fixes.
